headline.main: California Effort Trims Lung Cancer by 14%

docs.abstract: Federal government reports that California's tough anti-smoking measures and public health campaigns have resulted in 14 percent decrease in lung cancer over past 10 years; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention notes other regions of country report only 2.7 percent decrease in same period (S)

keywords.value: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: California's tough anti-smoking measures and public health campaigns have resulted in a 14 percent decrease in lung cancer over the past 10 years, the federal government reported today. Other regions of the country reported only a 2.7 percent decrease in the same period, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.
